meanings.definition: Strange or unusual in a way that is surprising or difficult to understand.
meanings.sent1: The oddest thing happened yesterday when my cat started speaking English!
meanings.sent2: It was the oddest sight to see a cow wearing sunglasses at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The oddest part of the magic show was when the rabbit pulled the magician out of the hat!
meanings.sent4: Her choice of outfit was the oddest puzzle piece in the fashion show.
meanings.sent5: The oddest cloud in the sky looked like a giant dragon breathing fire.

meanings.definition: Not easily explained or understood; strange or peculiar.
meanings.sent1: The oddest behavior from the robot made everyone laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: It's the oddest feeling when you can't remember where you parked your car.
meanings.sent3: The oddest sound came from the old piano, making the room feel haunted.
meanings.sent4: The oddest shadow on the wall resembled a dancing figure in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The oddest smell in the kitchen turned out to be burnt popcorn.

meanings.definition: Different from what is usual or expected; strange.
meanings.sent1: The oddest plant in the garden had purple leaves and orange flowers.
meanings.sent2: It was the oddest taste combination when she dipped her fries in ice cream.
meanings.sent3: The oddest sight on the hike was a squirrel wearing a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The oddest feeling washed over her as she entered the abandoned house.
meanings.sent5: The oddest noise in the forest turned out to be a singing frog.
